title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora states Marcelo Mayer must improve offensively to secure an Opening Day roster spot.
Mayer, 23, batted .228 with four home runs and 28 RBIs in 44 games last season.
Fully healthy for 2026 spring training, Mayer is competing primarily at second base and third base.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: A significant storm is predicted to impact southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island from Sunday night to Monday.
Forecasters warn of potential heavy snow, strong winds, coastal flooding, and possible power outages in the region.
Snowfall may exceed a foot in areas like the South Shore and Cape, with metro Boston also at risk.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court for her first in-person hearing since the alleged murder of her three children in 2023.
Clancy's defense team plans to use an insanity defense, citing postpartum mental illness and medication issues before the incident.
Her July murder trial will consider a bifurcated approach to address Clancy's mental state during the alleged killings.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly of Delegates approved a home rule petition for a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million.
The measure could generate up to $60 million annually for housing, with fees ranging from 0.5% to 4%.
90% of collected fees will be returned to towns, with 10% supporting a regional year-round housing trust.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police alerted the public to a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' on Friday at 3 p.m. for safety concerns.
Authorities are coordinating with local and state law enforcement to handle potential public safety issues at the event.
The incidents involve large gatherings for car activities, with previous cases causing property damage and safety risks.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven members of 'Harvard Street Gang' and a Randolph affiliate face drug and firearms charges in Massachusetts.
Investigators seized 25 firearms, kilograms of drugs, and tens of thousands in cash across Eastern Massachusetts locations.
Gang investigation since 2019 resulted in over 20 charged and seizures of more than 100 kilograms of drugs and 45 firearms.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Boston Celtics for the Golden State Warriors, citing reasons beyond basketball.
The Celtics aimed to reduce salary by getting under the second luxury tax apron.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla praised Horford, calling him a Hall-of-Famer and a supportive veteran.

title: Readers agree: Build a new Madison Park to benefit Boston’s youth
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston.com readers largely support building a new Madison Park vocational high school on the P-3 parcel in Roxbury.
The majority favor enhancing vocational education over the previously planned mixed-use development on the 7.7-acre site.
Readers argue new vocational facilities will bolster career opportunities for students without the college debt burden.

title: Planned Parenthood rolls out vasectomies at Mass. health centers
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Planned Parenthood League of Massachusetts now offers vasectomies at its Worcester location as part of its birth control services.
Demand for permanent contraception like vasectomies has surged after the overturning of federal abortion protections in June 2022.
Patients must schedule an in-person vasectomy consultation at any of four Planned Parenthood centers in Massachusetts.

title: Body of Eastham man who fell through ice located after days of searching
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Eastham man Jerry Boucher, 72, was found dead days after falling through ice with wife Kathleen at First Encounter Beach.
Kathleen Boucher, 71, was found dead shortly after the incident on February 14; the couple was walking their dog.
Emergency crews searched a marshy area near Bee’s River; Barnstable County Fire Department located Jerry Boucher's body Friday morning.
